thread.title: Cops Search for Woman Who Vandalized Tesla with Swastika and Trash in Brooklyn - VINnews
thread.title_full: Cops Search for Woman Who Vandalized Tesla with Swastika and Trash in Brooklyn - VINnews

title: Cops Search for Woman Who Vandalized Tesla with Swastika and Trash in Brooklyn - VINnews
text:
BROOKLYN – Authorities are on the lookout for a woman who vandalized a Tesla in a Brooklyn Jewish neighborhood by leaving a brick with a swastika and the word “Nazi” scrawled on it, along with a bag of trash dumped on the vehicle. The incident occurred Monday night on Ditmas Avenue near Ocean Parkway in Kensington, just after 8 p.m.
The 38-year-old owner of the Tesla discovered the hateful symbol and message on his car’s bumper and immediately called 911. According to police, the woman responsible also left a bag of trash on the vehicle before fleeing the scene on a scooter. She was last seen wearing a red puffy jacket and black pants.
The NYPD’s Hate Crime Task Force has opened an investigation, though no arrests have been made at this time.
This attack comes amid growing incidents of vandalism targeting Tesla vehicles, linked in part to controversy surrounding CEO Elon Musk’s role in the Trump administration’s “Department of Government Efficiency.” Just last week, a similar act of vandalism occurred in Bed-Stuy, where vandals etched a swastika and “Nazis” onto the side of a parked Cybertruck. As with Monday’s incident, no arrests have been made in that case.
Authorities are continuing to investigate the pattern of hate crimes targeting Tesla owners, with efforts to locate those responsible.
The @NYPD66Pct , along with @Shmira , are investigating an incident where a woman allegedly wrote “Nazi” and drew a swastika in chalk on a brick, then placed it on a Tesla Cybertruck. She also reportedly covered the vehicle with a garbage bag. The motive remains unclear—whether it… pic.twitter.com/EYnznIhhNX
— Boro Park 24 News (@BoroPark24) April 8, 2025
